newsitem.title: NAMIBIA: Namibian stocks week - Namibian Sea Products leads.
newsitem.headline: Namibian stocks week - Namibian Sea Products leads.

text.p: Namibian Sea Products enjoyed lively trade on the Namibian Stock Exchange last week, trading 58,700 shares and carrying its price to 70 cents from its opening at the start of the week of 67 cents.
Pep Namibia suffered losses last week, falling to N$4.00 per share from N$4.35 in a traded volume of 28,400 shares.
Local institutions bought and sold more than N$2 million worth of shares in dual-listed Standard Bank Investment Corp, but the share weakened to end at N$183.50 a share.
The total value of shares traded during the week was N$5 million, with a total volume of some 218,420 shares.
The NSE Overall Index ended the week at 232.95, up from 226.62 in the previous week.
The NSE Local Index slipped to 154.15 from 154.64.
